intro: Polycarpaea candidissima, commonly known as the white-flowered polycarpaea, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are opposite, simple, and often have a slightly hairy texture. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories.
